1. Norby: 1363 (lvl 3) - Cannot find this hotel. European site I presume?The full username is Norby89.
8. 3rem: 734 (level 4) - No starsCorrection: level 7

I think this thread could get confused because of the different things people (and the game itself) mean when they talk of "level". My hotel could be classed as a) Level 0 (because I haven't bequeathed), b) Level 4 (because that's the highest level of research reached), or c) Level 7 (because I've paid the consortium tax 6 times). As far as I'm aware, you can see what level a hotel is senses a and b when you visit, but sense c is only visible if that person is on your friends list - although the type of guests staying might give a reasonable indication of the level reached.

On november 15, 2011
Djisas
with 4 dogsbodies you get 9 guests\day, every 2h
With 3 you get 6
with 2 you get 5

Having 4 makes a big difference, and you save more money than by doing campaigns, and with 30k, seriously its enough for 20 rooms and 4 dogs, and then its just saving up money again...

My tip is to bequeath on sunday after guests leave, you wont waste any time on lvl 2, and if you plan to do research lvl 3 is better because abominations are worth 40% progress, then pay tax next sunday, and on lvl 4, you can make up between 1000-1300 on a single night with proper research on blobs and fish, you wont research plants, hysterical, bombs or pyros, they are a waste of time if you bequeath on lvl 5 again...
Racket is always a good upgrade for ex, very worth the time spent, in your sky in just 4 levels saves you more money than that earned on 2 days, the rest is really optional, like im starting to think investing time on feel good and Job's a good 'un will be a waste for me, i always have enough gifts and other stuff for the guests thanks to racket, so i wont need to use the dog's services...

It all comes down to your playing style and how long your hotel will last...

On december 14, 2011
npfan
According to my calculations, if you indeed started off with 80000 when you bequeathed, then that means you earned nearly around another 70000 in a week, or it would be impossible to get to the point you are right now.

Not to mention that I'm basing the prices of rooms 31-48 based on how much it costs to build rooms 27-30, so the amount could be much more in reality.

For simplicity, let's assume the "conservative" estimate of 70000 in one week. That comes out to 10000 a day. Let's say you make use of the 9 guests you get each day for free, plus about another 16 guests from buying all the advertisements you have. That's a total of 25 a day. To account for guests that stay for two nights, let's say you had about 15 guests stay for two nights. That's equivalent to about 32.5 guests paying twice a day. That means each guest pays 154 per payment. There's one problem, the maximum amount your guests can pay at one time is 80.

And yet, all of that math could be completely irrelevant because then the question becomes how you manage to get 80000 when you bequeathed for the third time.

Kompera
I was suggesting long ago to change the ranking system and order hotels first by number of stars and only then by fame points. This would reward players who put the most effort and bequeathed most times.I don't think that would have the effect you are looking for. Players who buy tokens and use them to purchase VIP ad campaigns have access to additional levels of fame than is possible from simply plodding along in the game. But that is no more or less an advantage than a player who buys tokens and uses them to purchase rooms faster to speed bequeath speed. Regardless of the meter, the player who buys tokens will be in the lead. That is a part of the business model of the free games Motion Twin/Twinoid publishes.

Kompera
Take a look at his hotel...he has built far more rooms than all the players that have spent on this game. Explain that.There a couple of ways to make a lot more than most players even if the others buy some . Almost all of them would be violations of the TOS, and therefore 'cheating', if you equate violating the TOS with cheating.

) A player could be sharing their account and therefore have more eyes/hours of the day to respond to requests for service, which will increase his payout per guest over a player who only actively plays 1-3 30 minute sessions per day. Jarrette already said that he had been doing just that, but when informed that it was against the TOS he said he'd stop;
) A player might be able to automate responses to requests for service. I program in a few languages, but flash isn't one of them. So this may not be possible, and I'm not going to investigate it. But it seems to be within the realm of possibilities to script something that responds to a request for service automatically. Or even more complex, to respond to requests for service for all monsters except bombs which are already at 8 satisfaction. And to respond to blobs and other high payout guests first;
) A player could never sleep, or just spend more time than most people have available to them to pay attention to the game. This would of course be completely legitimate.

I don't know if any of these three methods would make so much of a difference in guest payouts that it could explain how Jarrette has accomplished what he has accomplished. But any of the methods above lend themselves to the multiples of services (laundromatix, etc.) which Jarrette builds into each of his hotels.

sebis7

Hello everybody!

As you can see in my previous post, I decided to update the top 15 list. However, I will not be able to update it every week like Vidriel did, that's why I thought of a way to let everybody help with the updating task.

I wrote down a simple textfile named "MonsterMotel_Top15.txt" where I put in the today's top 15 list and a couple of instructions for editing it. I didn't like editing the list directly in the new forum, that's why I chose this workaround.

Then I uploaded it to my dropbox so everybody can download and edit it in the future.
Download the textfile - http://db.tt/lUVhC1US

If you want to update the list, please edit the whole textfile, copy&paste the new list in the forum, upload the updated textfile to a filesharing service and add a download link at the end of your forum post.

I hope this works.. if anybody has a better idea of splitting up the work, just post it here.

Kompera
ZamboniTrue, except it takes over a year to get from 6 star to 7 star (especially with crappy campaigns!).

Campaigns have little or nothing to do with advancing to the next star rank. I'm at 5 stars and have 69 rooms and have never needed to purchase a campaign to fill them to near capacity.


If I bought a campaign I'd probably not be able to place a lot of the guests I just paid money to attract to the hotel! Of at least, not place them without screwing with satisfaction levels of already placed guests.

Now, if you chose not to staff your reception desk, that's a different story. But that's your choice, not something that forces you to buy ad campaigns.

On march 26, 2013
TradeFederation

The probability of a regular guest being a VIP seems to be fixed regardless of where you get your guests from. I've gotten VIP's from my normal guests, and normal campaigns at about the same rate. I've also accidentally 'spent' 5 tokens on a direct purchased guest from the link, but it was just a normal guest, so that does not seem like a great source. Buying normal campaigns for Croqueuro is the cheapest way to get more guests, if your hotel is big enough for all of them, you should net make money on most campaigns. The best way to buy guests for real money is to purchase employee 5 and 6, and put them at the desk with the other 4. That will pull 15 extra guests every day, at no additional cost.


I'm working on the odds of a guest being VIP, but they are fairly low, something like 1 in every 50-100. You are much better off just using the prestigious client campaigns, as even bringing in another 30 guests a day will not guaranty you a VIP, but it will keep you very busy placing guests !

TradeFederation

Campaigns are only slightly relevant to running a hotel for profit, unless you play free (4 employees) or have a huge hotel. However, when it comes to fame stars, the VIP campaigns are almost essential to reaching the top ranks, and this IS the hall of fame thread.


Unfortunately, its completely random how many VIP's you can bring in with campaigns over the 1 VIP you will always be able to buy, so these ranks are highly luck dependent. Without the right campaigns you could buy all your campaigns, fill a large hotel every day, and check everyone out with 10 satisfaction, but still fall behind someone that buys 3-6 VIP's daily and just farms fame from them

On april 5, 2013
TradeFederation

5000 friends, with 8000 total guests, that's pretty clear cheating, no doubt, but why ? Why would you cheat on such an easy and purely single player game ? You can always get more real guests at no cost every day, and these friend guests don't even pay any cash, so outside of the 1 star and desirable effects, I don't even see why it would be worth loading all those fake accounts and sending all those guests in the first place, from a fame perspective. I suppose this does make sense from a day-to-day normal guest view. I noticed right off the bat that you could 10 satisfy a lot of guests with a few well-chosen friend guests, and actually felt that they made the game too easy, even getting just a legitimate 1 or 2 of them in a small hotel. I guess some people got addicted to the easy way to satisfy guests. I guess you could call it the Tour De Hotels Friend Doping scandal


I guess it makes sense to exclude some players who have too many friend guests. both these guys have more friend guests than me by a factor of 10 to 50 times, so its probably not too hard to spot them.
